scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. You explained that it was a one-time thing to make sure the team didn't struggle. [Monica] frowns slightly, and you expressed that if the team needs you this often, they need to learn to cope without you. [Bob] raises an eyebrow slightly. You agreed with Bob that you should have been more tactful in expressing your concerns.
scenes.description: [Monica] looks at you thoughtfully, 'I appreciate your honesty, [Alex], but do you think it might have come off as a bit harsh?' [Bob] nods in agreement.

options.text: Maybe it did, but sometimes the truth is necessary for change.
options.analysis: You acknowledge the possibility of being harsh but emphasize the importance of honesty, showing balanced emotional regulation and social skills.

options.text: You're right, Monica. I should have found a better way to express my concerns without sounding harsh.
options.analysis: You agree with the concern, showing strong empathy and emotional perception but lower social skills and motivation.

options.text: If being honest means sounding harsh, then maybe we need to rethink how we handle feedback in the team.
options.analysis: You take a more assertive stance, showing strong self-regulation but lower empathy and motivation.
